alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 4:02PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF RAIN SHOWERS WITH STRONG WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION, NORTHEASTERN MORA AND COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of rain showers near Raton Crews Airport, to near Raton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raton, Springer, Cimarron, Eagle Nest, Maxwell, Des Moines, Folsom, Capulin, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Sugarite. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 396 and 460. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 285 and 390. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Union County
